availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hopkins County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Nancy J Woodruff Cardwell. Father of Thomas L Cardwell, David E. Cardwell, and Cordelia Cardwell. Owned two enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Democratic Party. Member of the Hopkins County Christian Church in Madisonville, Kentucky. Farmed in Hopkins County from 1840 to 1881.

bibl.p: W. H. Perrin, J. H. Battle, and G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville: F. A. Battey and Company, 1887), 767; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, p. 242-243; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hopkins County, Madisonville, p. 25; "W. W. Cardwell," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=66862292&ref=acom) (accessed on march 23, 2017).
